recommendations.body: **Bars** should be avoided and required to close.
**Bars** should be avoided and required to close.
**Gyms** should be avoided and required to close.
​​**Restaurants** should max at 25% capacity. Local governments must assist in expanding outdoor dining opportunities. Customers should use take-out or eat outdoors socially distanced.

**Restaurants** should create outdoor dining opportunities, with the assistance of local governments. Customers should use take-out, outdoor dining, or indoor dining when strict social distancing can be maintained.
**Masks** should be mandated and worn by everyone outside their home.
**Masks** should be mandated in all indoor spaces and worn by everyone outside their home.
**Gatherings** should be avoided with people outside the immediate household.

**Gatherings** should be limited to 25 people and physical distance should be maintained. The CDC also recommends that [gatherings take place outdoors](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/daily-life-coping/deciding-to-go-out.html).
**Schools:** Enable remote learning for all students. All government levels should invest in remote learning.

**Schools:** If [safe learning spaces](https://globalepidemics.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/pandemic_resilient_schools_briefing_72020.pdf) exist, phase re-opening: 1st priority: preK-5 and special education services for preK-8. 2nd priority: grades 6-8 and special education services for grades 9-12.

**Schools:** If [safe learning spaces](https://globalepidemics.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/pandemic_resilient_schools_briefing_72020.pdf) exist, phase re-opening: 1st priority: preK-5 and special education services for preK-8. 2nd priority: grades 6-8 and special education services for grades 9-12. 3rd priority: grades 9-12 on a hybrid schedule.

**Schools:** In person education is appropriate only if conditions for [safe learning spaces](https://globalepidemics.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/pandemic_resilient_schools_briefing_72020.pdf) are in place.

**Masks** should be worn outside of the home, according to [CDC guidelines](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/cloth-face-cover-guidance.html), to continue reducing the spread of COVID.
**Travel** should be avoided unless necessary, according to [CDC guidelines](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/faqs.html).

footer.shareText: Please share with policy makers, business owners, and any other decision makers, especially if these recommendations don’t match reality.
